intro: Trisepalum acutum, commonly known as the sharp-sepal plant, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers with three sepals and no petals, which is a distinctive botanical feature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. The genus Trisepalum is part of the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants such as cotton and hibiscus.
